text_cards.caption: CHINESE CANNON
text_cards.description: A rook takes by throwing a friendly piece so that it jumps the rook in a rook direction.
text_cards.quote: I spend most of my life feeling like I've been shot out of a cannon. ---Molly Ivins

text_cards.caption: COOLDOWN
text_cards.description: You may not use the same piece on two consecutive turns.
text_cards.quote: Itâ€™s easier to cool down a fanatic than to warm up a corpse. ---Michael L. Brown

text_cards.caption: BEROLINA PAWNS II
text_cards.description: Pawns move diagonally. The take forward and sideways.
text_cards.quote: Berolina is the female personification of Berlin and the allegorical female figure symbolizing the city. ---Wikipedia

text_cards.caption: NIGHT WIZARD
text_cards.description: Move/take life a giraffe [1,3], or one square diagonally [1,1]. May not be dropped for check.
text_cards.quote: Do not meddle in the affairs of Wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger. ---J. R. R. Tolkien

text_cards.caption: IMMOBILIZER
text_cards.description: Pieces adjacent to an enemy Rook may not move. Rooks may not capture.
text_cards.quote: The activity of worrying keeps you immobilized. ---Wayne Dyer

text_cards.caption: BANISHER
text_cards.description: \small Bishops only move like Queens and banish an adjacent non-King enemy piece to any empty square.
text_cards.quote: I know that you cannot banish the truth permanently, you can only cloud it temporarily. ---Javed Jaffrey
